author: TravisEz13
body:
<!--

If you are running a released version of PowerShell but not the latest one, install the latest from https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/releases and try to repro it again

Before submitting this issue, please first:

- [ ] Search the existing issues.
- [ ] Refer to the [FAQ](../docs/FAQ.md).
- [ ] Refer to the [known issues](../docs/KNOWNISSUES.md).
- [ ] If it is a bug, fill out this form:
-->
## Steps to reproduce

```
get-winevent -LogName System  
```
## Expected behavior

The command should run without error
## Actual behavior

```
get-winevent : Could not find any resources appropriate for the specified culture or the neutral culture.  Make sure
"GetEventResources.resources" was correctly embedded or linked into assembly
"Microsoft.PowerShell.Commands.Diagnostics" at compile time, or that all the satellite assemblies required are
loadable and fully signed.
At line:1 char:1
+ get-winevent
+ ~~~~~~~~~~~~
    + CategoryInfo          : NotSpecified: (:) [Get-WinEvent], MissingManifestResourceException
    + FullyQualifiedErrorId : System.Resources.MissingManifestResourceException,Microsoft.PowerShell.Commands.GetWinEv
   entCommand
```
## Environment data

Same error on a SxS install on full windows and on Nano

<!-- If running the latest released version, specify the version, i.e. -->

v0.4.0

<!-- If running you own build, please fill in the results of the following commands: -->

``` powershell
> $PSVersionTable
Name                           Value
----                           -----
GitCommitId                    v0.5.0-60-g09238a9f1a05e1b3655f4862c941e31a8371905a
BuildVersion                   3.0.0.0
PSCompatibleVersions           {1.0, 2.0, 3.0, 4.0...}
WSManStackVersion              3.0
PSEdition                      Core
SerializationVersion           1.1.0.1
PSVersion                      5.1.10032.0
PSRemotingProtocolVersion      2.3
CLRVersion

```

``` sh
$ dotnet --info
https://ci.appveyor.com/project/PowerShell/powershell/build/0.4.0.2555/artifacts

$ git rev-parse HEAD; git status
https://ci.appveyor.com/project/PowerShell/powershell/build/0.4.0.2555/artifacts

```

comments.author: andschwa
comments.body: Yes, the resources are named differently in PowerShell dues to .NET CLI. If something is calling the old resource, that means the DLL needs to be ported to PowerShell. So I think this is really the [PSEvents issue](https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/issues/1031#issuecomment-222013663).

comments.author: vors
comments.body: I think it may be different. I will investigate

comments.author: mgreenegit
comments.body:
edit: the symptoms below are just a result of https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/issues/1122

This cmdlet has a number of errors on Linux.  Unless it can be run against a remote Windows node, should it just be hidden (or removed)?

PS /home/mgroot> get-winevent
get-winevent : The 'get-winevent' command was found in the module
'Microsoft.PowerShell.Diagnostics', but the module could not be loaded. For
more information, run 'Import-Module Microsoft.PowerShell.Diagnostics'.
<truncated>

PS /home/mgroot> get-command get-winevent
get-command : The term 'get-winevent' is not recognized as the name of a
cmdlet, function, script file, or operable program. Check the spelling of the
name, or if a path was included, verify that the path is correct and try again.
<truncated>

PS /home/mgroot> get-help det-winevent -detailed
get-help : The method or operation is not implemented.out-lineoutput : The method or operation is not implemented.
<truncated>

comments.author: TravisEz13
comments.body: The resource issue also repro on the Master-SD build

title: Get-WinEvent fail with error loading resource
